results.name: default/mysql-59ccc86664-xfzzt
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is unable to pull the Docker image "mysql:5.7" from the registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull mysql:5.7`.

results.name: default/wordpress-85fb884465-74c92
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-59ccc86664-xfzzt], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod mysql-59ccc86664-xfzzt`.
3. Look for readiness probe issues.
4. Fix any configuration errors.
5. Restart the pod if needed.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-85fb884465-74c92], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the specified pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod wordpress-85fb884465-74c92`.
3. Look for readiness probe issues or errors.
4. Fix any identified issues and redeploy if necessary.
